page.title: 09KING'S NEWNHAM II
page.content:
Amenities & Attractions cont.
Additional amenities consist of: a garage, a telephone box, a public house, a church, a dove cote, a village green and a small school. Running between the villages is the River Avon. Just beside this are some attractive fish ponds. One of these is used by anglers and yields fish such as Carp, Bream, Rudd, Roach, Perch and Sticklebacks. The two other ponds have been left stagnent since their former use as healing spas in the 17th century.
Occupations
The job situation here is virtually identical to that of Long Lawford.
